summary: Completed testing of Export to Jira/Azure DevOps functionality. Fixed 2 bugs: 1) Backend TypeError when acceptance_criteria is None (fixed null handling with 'or' operator), 2) Frontend API URLs missing '/api' prefix (fixed all 4 fetch calls). All 21 backend tests passed. Frontend Export page verified working with epic selector, file export buttons, Jira/Azure DevOps configuration tabs, and export preview.
passed_tests: GET /api/export/field-mappings - Returns 200 with Jira and Azure DevOps mappings
GET /api/export/preview/{epic_id} - Returns 200 with epic preview data
Frontend Export page shows epic selector
Frontend Export page shows file export buttons (Jira CSV, Azure DevOps CSV, JSON, Markdown)
Frontend Export page shows Jira configuration tab with URL, Project Key, Email, API Token inputs
Frontend Export page shows Azure DevOps configuration tab with Organization, Project, PAT inputs
Export buttons are disabled when no epic selected
Export buttons are enabled when epic is selected
Export preview shows item counts (Epic, Features, Stories, Bugs)

bugs_fixed.issue: TypeError: can only join an iterable - when acceptance_criteria is None
bugs_fixed.fix: Changed .get('acceptance_criteria', []) to .get('acceptance_criteria') or [] to handle explicit None values

bugs_fixed.issue: API calls missing /api prefix - preview, file export, jira export, azure export all failing with 404
bugs_fixed.fix: Added /api prefix to all 4 fetch URLs: /api/export/preview, /api/export/file, /api/export/jira, /api/export/azure-devops

bugs_fixed.issue: React hooks ordering - loadPreview useCallback defined after useEffect that uses it
bugs_fixed.fix: Moved loadPreview and loadEpics function definitions before the useEffect hooks that depend on them

critical_code_review_comments: Export service properly handles null/None values for all optional fields
Field mappings correctly map JarlPM entities to Jira and Azure DevOps work item types
CSV exports include proper headers for both Jira and Azure DevOps import formats
Direct API integration to Jira/Azure DevOps requires user credentials - cannot be tested without real credentials
test_credentials: Test user: testuser@jarlpm.dev via 'Test Login' button. Session token: test_session_jarlpm_full_access_2025
seed_data_creation: Created test epics during testing (TEST_Export_Epic, TEST_Export_UI_Epic) - cleaned up after tests
context_for_next_testing_agent: Export to Jira/Azure DevOps feature is fully working. Backend APIs: GET /api/export/field-mappings, GET /api/export/preview/{epic_id}, POST /api/export/file (supports jira_csv, azure_devops_csv, json, markdown formats). Frontend Export page at /export with tabs for File Export, Jira, and Azure DevOps. Direct API integration to Jira/Azure DevOps requires user credentials. File exports work correctly and can be downloaded.
